section.title: Introduction
section.para: The onCourse Editor is your platform to create, manage and distribute information to your website. Editor is a Content Managment System (CMS) that provides simple but powerful tools to manage the struture and content of your website in a collaborative environment.

section.title: Logging In
section.para: Access the editor by visiting your website and adding '#editor' at the end of the url. For example, if your website url is 'http://www.acme.com.au' the editor can be accessed at 'xml http://www.acme.com.au#editor'.
Log in using the same credentials that you use to access onCourse.

section.title: The Editor View
section.para: Once logged in, a toolbar is visible to the left hand side of the window. You can continue to browse through your site as normal while logged into the Editor.

On the toolbar, you can see icons that allows you to quickly access the primary areas of the Editor. At the bottom of the toolbar, there is an option to publish any changes you've made to the live site,and a log of all recent changes.

section.title: Blocks
section.para: Blocks are the cornerstone to your website's variety and page dynamics. Blocks are re-usable snippets of text, pictures, rich text markup, javascript, etc. If you wanted to add a banner on every page of your web siteor an area on several different pages dedicated to a contact form, blocks are ideal.

caption.para: The Blocks page allows you to easily add, search and edit blocks.

section.title: Editing a block
section.para: Selecting a block takes you to the Editor page for that specific block. Here, you can change the name of the block and edit the contents. On the right hand side of the screen you see a preview of what the block will look like on your website ***can this screenshot include some content?

Click on the block contents to open the block in a text editor view. Enter your markup text or html to be added to the block and click save. This closes the text editor and renders your changes for you to review.

section.title: Design
section.para: The Design menu lets you edit the Themes applied to your onCourse website.

section.title: Themes
section.para: Themes are a way to describe a page structure made up by a number of blocks and is a design layout created for you by your designer. There will always be a layout called "default". If you want different parts of your site to have very different looks, ask your designer to create alternative layouts for you to use.

Each theme can have a number of blocks arranged in any way you choose. There are five regions available:
header
left
content
right
footer
Each region can contain one or more blocks which you click and drag from the right area ***the right hand side?. To remove a block, click and drag it back into the list of unused blocks on the right. Order the blocks on the page by clicking and dragging them into position. Remember, when the page is shown the content area will also contain any content for the page itself ***What?. The blocks are shown above the page content, although your web designer can change that if they choose.

section.title: Change Log
section.para: View the change log by clicking 'Edits' from the toolbar. The change log displays the most recent versions of the site, the date this version of the site was publish and who published each version of the site. You can also see the current version of the site and have the option to publish your changes from this page.

section.title: Reverting Changes
section.para: For each published revision of the site, there is an option to revert to that version. Click 'Revert' to revert the site to how it was on the given date. Note that this cannot be undone.

section.title: Publishing your changes
section.para: Any changes you've made are only visbile when logged into the Editor. Your site must be publshed before any changes appear on the live site.

To publish your changes to your live site, click 'Publish' from the bottom of the toolbar. This prompts you to confirm that you want the changes published. Click 'Confirm' to commit any changes you have made and make these changes visible on the live site. ***can you review this screenshot please?
